intro: Hieracium brunopolitanum, commonly known as the Brunpoles hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal, rough, and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium brunopolitanum is often found in moist environments and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
